attributes.action: HMRC to publicise availability of tax rebates
attributes.additional_details:
We see many television adverts about government initiatives and for things such as completing your tax credits forms.  I don’t recall seeing one about claiming a tax rebate for washing your uniform.  Why?  This is a HMRC allowance that they seem to keep tucked away on their website and ordinary people are reliant upon tax rebate companies such as www.u-tax.net to make them aware.

Why doesn’t HMRC advertise the availability of uniform tax rebates and make it simple to claim them.
